links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(10)=5 because 1, 2 and 5 are the Fibonacci numbers which divide 10 and 5 is the largest.
prog: (PARI) A010056(n)=my(k=n^2); k+=(k+1)<<2; issquare(k) || (n>0 && issquare(k-8))a(n)=fordiv(n,d,if(A010056(n/d), return(n/d))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 05 2014
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 04 2000
